intro: Calyptridium arizonicum, commonly known as Arizona tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Calyptridium arizonicum is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
